item.title: How to create a network share via Samba via CLI
item.description: 1. Install Samba sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install samba 2. Set a password for your user in Samba sudo smbpasswd -a <user_name> 3. Create a directory to be shared mkdir /home/<user_name>/<folder_name> 4. Make a safe backup copy of the original smb.conf file to your home folder, in case you make an error sudo cp /etc/samba/smb.conf ~ 5. Edit the file “/etc/samba/smb.conf” sudo vim /etc/samba/smb.conf smb.
